title: Acceleration of a box sliding up a ramp

content.question: A box of mass <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> slides up a ramp with initial velocity <math alttext="positive v sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. The kinetic friction force on the box has magnitude <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math>. Which of the following is a correct equation that could be used to determine the acceleration <math alttext="a" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi></math> of the box?

choices.label: <math alttext="m g times the sine of theta, minus f, equals m a" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>sin</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>θ</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>f</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>a</mi></math>

<math alttext="f minus m g, times the sine of theta, equals m a" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>sin</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>a</mi></math>

<math alttext="negative f minus m g, times the sine of theta, equals m a" overflow="scroll"><mo>-</mo><mi>f</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>sin</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>a</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="negative f minus m g, times the sine of theta, equals m a" overflow="scroll"><mo>-</mo><mi>f</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>sin</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>a</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
